title: Did PlayStation Just Tease Uncharted 5? - Kinda Funny Games Daily 01.30.23
description:
Go to http://grammarly.com/KINDAFUNNY to get 20% off when you’re ready to upgrade to Grammarly Premium.

Greg and Tim break down that new PlayStation ad-spot, Spongebob Cosmic Shake reviews, and Hi-Fi Rush's great sales!

Time Stamps:
00:00:00 - Start
00:09:15 - Housekeeping
- Our episode 3 review of HBO’s The Last of Us is up right now on Youtube.com/KindaFunny
        -  The Roper Report   -
00:10:20 - What is this new PS5 ad teasing?
00:20:16 - SpongeBob SquarePants: The Cosmic Shake review round up
00:26:21 - In their debut week, Hi-Fi Rush reportedly outperformed Forspoken on Steam
00:33:54 - Phoebe Waller-Bridge is Prepping a ‘Tomb Raider’ TV Series for Amazon
00:41:16 - RIP Annie Wersching, Who Played Tess In The Last Of Us
00:42:26 - Street Fighter 6 adds Thea Trinidad to the game as a commentator
00:44:25 - Out today
00:48:35 - You‘re Wrong
00:50:49 - Rumbleverse Rumors
Tomorrow’s Hosts: Greg & Bless
Epic Creator Code: KindaFunny

SpongeBob SquarePants The Cosmic Shake is a simple unambitious platformer that pales in comparison to its peers in every way the spot besides all the charm and humor it borrows from the iconic show whether it's the incredibly basic

Shake is a simple unambitious platformer that pales in comparison to its peers in every way the spot besides all the charm and humor it borrows from the iconic show whether it's the incredibly basic jumping and Swinging that becomes irksome repetitive within irximately repetitive within minutes or the humdrum combat that has you mopping up the same handful of enemies hundreds of times without anything meaningful to differentiate the first battle from the last Cosmic Shake badly lacks the imagination and creativity for which the show is known the original cast voice performances and silly gags are certainly a highlight but if you were hoping for something akin to Super Mario Odyssey and a pineapple under the sea sadly This falls short I can assure you Travis at no point since the announcement of Super Mario I'm sorry since SpongeBob SquarePants and the cosmic Shake if I thought it was going to be Super Mario Odyssey but again I appreciate people holding them the level James Carr

of Super Mario I'm sorry since SpongeBob SquarePants and the cosmic Shake if I thought it was going to be Super Mario Odyssey but again I appreciate people holding them the level James Carr Gamespot however gave it a 7 out of ten says classic SpongeBob humor combined with solid platforming makes for a fun Nostalgia trip through the Multiverse in the cosmic shake and then the one the only the boss baby Barrett Courtney and kind of funny gave it a 4 out of 5 in this Tick Tock if you're a normal person SpongeBob SquarePants The Cosmic Shake will probably just be an okay game for you it's a decent enough 3D platformer where you play as the title character exploring alternate versions of classic Bikini Bottom locations beating up baddies and collecting random items for side quests and cute costumes to run around in all wrapped in PS2 era Jank that would probably turn most people away but if you played SpongeBob SquarePants Battle for Bikini Bottom as a kid and loved it like myself I think

to run around in all wrapped in PS2 era Jank that would probably turn most people away but if you played SpongeBob SquarePants Battle for Bikini Bottom as a kid and loved it like myself I think the cosmic Shake is a great spiritual successor to a cult classic the magic of running around is SpongeBob hanging out with the characters you know and love and juggling at the gags that feel like the classic show back from the early 2000s it all brought me back to my childhood and that's all it needed to be a spiritual successor to a 3D platformer game from almost two decades ago it could have turned out much worse the cosmic Shake introduces a good mix of new and remixed ideas while also keeping what made Battle for Bikini Bottom special familiar enough to feel like the classic we know and love but not too familiar that we just feel like we're playing the same game over again it's a labor of love for us SpongeBob dorks and I honestly can't wait for y'all to play it and get transported back to
